titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The sudden warmth of the weather makes one feel inert & undone. However I managed to compose the address for the Cathedral service on May 3
. I walked to the photographer, & suffered him to take two shots at my ugly face.
expresses great indignation at the cryptic aggression of S
Margaret's. He has tabled a question in the House of Commons. It will be rather interesting to see how things develope
. I thought it judicious to write to Pearce in order that he might be 'seized of the facts', & able if opportunity arose to enlighten Downing Street.
Divers guests lunched here, & viewed both the Deanery & the Cathedral. Then I attended Evensong, & afterwards walked with Nickson.
Ella went off to Newcastle for another dose of Wagner. I wrote a number of letters.
